comment.author: 26287620@N08
comment._content: This is quite a scenery to look at.  Along the Mississippi River levee this image really contradicts 'The Great Depression'.

comment.author: 25036263@N02
comment._content: Looks like corn being cultivated near the house, but it is only knee high. The grass on the levee looks parched and the area is short on moisture and rainfall. Congressman William Jefferson of New Orleans was born near this time and place.

comment.author: 31921430@N08
comment._content:
this is amazing
i love it

comment.author: 21204781@N07
comment._content: From the clouds I'd swear it was HDR if it wasn't LOC and 1940.  Must have used a yellow filter. Kodachrome was only four years old.

comment.author: 38121695@N05
comment._content: This photo of a tenant farmer's home on the farm has amazing detail and color for a photo from this time period. It's tagged as Great Depression, but it seems that this was taken during the expansion out of it (1940). It really does give you a feeling for how each day was as a farmer, pretty routine and demanding of hard work.

comment.author: 10769139@N05
comment._content: Colors are so beautifully saturated, can feel the richness of the soil.
